On Mon, Jun 9, 2008 at 6:57 PM, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Thank you for the clear case for logging assertions. This feature has been
> "on the list" for at least eight of the ten years JUnit has been in
> existence. The problem is that I have never found a way to add it without
> breaking the architecture. For me, the additional ugliness has always
> outweighed the additional utility. I'm open to suggestions, though.

A possible solution:
1) Create a logging interface, with methods like TestStart, AssertXXX,
TestFinish, etc.
2) Create a null instance that is used by default.
3) Use an annotation (Java or C# term - I can never keep them
straight) to mark the logger to use.

This is the simplest solution I can think of.

BTW I do understand why many oppose this feature.
